title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
text: Have you found your way here because you‚Äôre part of a catchment group and interested in a 3D-printed topographic model of your catchment? If so, you‚Äôre in the right place.

title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
section: What‚Äôs the point in a 3D printed model?
text:
What‚Äôs the point in a 3D printed model?
In a previous post, I described these models as a ‚Äútangible, miniature representations of the landscape that you can hold in your hands.‚Äù They‚Äôre definitely not going to change the world, but they might serve as a conversation starter as you gather around the table to talk about your environmental goals and aspirations.



Koukourarata / Port Levy, Te Roto o Wairewa / Lake Forsyth, Te Waihora / Lake Ellesmere


These models offer a less abstract view of the landscape compared to a 2D paper map, focusing on elevation to reduce distractions. For visual thinkers, they can reveal connections and scales otherwise only visible from a helicopter.
By mapping the entire catchment, the model embodies the concept of Ki uta ki tai‚Äîa te ao MƒÅori perspective on integrated, indivisible land and river management, from the mountains to the sea.
And they‚Äôre just damn cool.

title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
text:
How big are they?





Puketoi FMU made up of Akitio, Owahanga and Wainui catchments






Puketoi FMU assembled



My standard sized model is around 200mm long. This is a good size to hold in your hand or pass around.
If you want a bigger model, my printer can print up to ~300mm long in a single printed block. If you want larger than this, I can print multiple blocks which are either glued together or snap together with a dovetail joint. This is a bit more work, but it‚Äôs definitely possible.
Another option is to print multiple sub-catchments separately, the largest of which can take up the maximum size of the printer. If these sub-catchments are printed at a common scale, they should fit together like a jigsaw puzzle.

title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
section: What‚Äôs this going to cost me?
text:
What‚Äôs this going to cost me?
Please get in touch and I can provide a quote based on the complexity of the design. Pricing is heavily discounted for catchment groups and mainly designed to cover my consumable costs.
I‚Äôm located in Christchurch and can post anywhere. Please allow 2-3 weeks lead time.





Whangateau






Upper Ruamahanga

title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
section: I Want Something Completely Custom‚ÄîCan You Do That?
text:
I Want Something Completely Custom‚ÄîCan You Do That?
Probably! Get in touch and let‚Äôs figure it out. Some requests I‚Äôve already had include:

Larger prints comprised of multiple blocks
Commercial projects for businesses or councils
Personal requests for individuals
Preparing files for laser cutting or CNC routing
Sub-catchments that fit together like a jigsaw puzzle

title: 3D-printed models for catchment groups
section: Okay, I want one. How does the process work?
text:
Okay, I want one. How does the process work?





Ruakituri


Fantastic! I‚Äôm here to help make this a reality. Here are the steps to consider:

Location: The catchment must be in New Zealand. Anywhere in New Zealand is fine, but very small catchments may require LiDAR data, which isn‚Äôt available everywhere.
Define your area of interest: This doesn‚Äôt have to be a hydrological catchment. It can be a square, circle, sub-catchment, FMU, or multiple catchments. Any contiguous boundary works.
Obtain a shapefile: It‚Äôs easiest if you can provide a GIS shapefile (.shp) of your area of interest. Otherwise if it‚Äôs a catchment, I can likely derive this for you.
Get in touch: Fill out this Google form:



Loading‚Ä¶

title: 3D Printing Services for GIS Professionals
text:
Northern Tauranga Harbour, draining 8 catchments with separate colours for native vegetation, roads, and mud flats.
Already working with spatial data? Let us help you turn it into something tangible.
At KƒÅkƒÅp≈ç Industries, we provide a streamlined, professional 3D printing service specifically for GIS analysts, cartographers, and spatial data professionals. Whether you‚Äôre seeking a complete end-to-end solution, or simply need a trusted partner to print a model you‚Äôve designed, we offer tailored services to suit your technical capabilities and project needs.

title: 3D Printing Services for GIS Professionals
text:
Option 1: From Shapefiles to 3D Model

Provide your spatial datasets ‚Äî we‚Äôll do the rest.
This full-service option is ideal if you have GIS expertise but want to outsource the 3D design and printing. Simply send us your shapefiles, GeoTIFFs, or other spatial layers, and we‚Äôll create a bespoke, print-ready terrain model using high-resolution DEM and LiDAR data, styled and scaled to your specifications.
We handle:

Catchment delineation or use of supplied polygons
Terrain extraction and downsampling
Integration of rivers, roads, land use, and other vector layers
Elevation exaggeration, colouring, and terrain smoothing
Multi-part tiling for large format models

Deliverables:

3D printed, physical model shipped to your door
Optional: STL or OBJ files for digital preview or reuse
Optional: Screenshots or videos for stakeholder presentations

title: 3D Printing Services for GIS Professionals
text:
Option 2: Print-Ready File?

We‚Äôll QA + Print It Already building your own terrain models using tools like Blender, QGIS, or GIS-to-STL workflows? We offer a QA/QC + print-only service for advanced users.
You send us your STL (or equivalent) file, and we:

Check for thin walls, overhangs, and other printability issues
Fix non-manifold edges or slicing errors
Optimise the file for multi-colour FDM printing if desired
Print in your choice of material and scale

This is ideal for:

Academic researchers producing custom site models
GIS teams building outreach tools
Environmental consultants visualising terrain data

Get in Touch
Ready to elevate your spatial work into the third dimension?
üì® Contact us to discuss your project, share files, or request a quote. We‚Äôre happy to collaborate directly with GIS teams and can work with a wide range of formats including .shp, .gpkg, .tif, .stl, and .obj.

title: Welcome.
text:
At KƒÅkƒÅp≈ç Industries, we transform geospatial data into beautiful, tangible models of the natural world. Using precision 3D printing, we craft detailed topographic and bathymetric representations that honour the form and flow of Aotearoa‚Äôs landscapes.
From braided rivers and coastal cliffs to alpine ridgelines and rolling hill country‚Äîour models turn digital terrain into physical artefacts you can hold, display, and explore.
Whether you‚Äôre an environmental scientist, engagement advisor, educator, or outdoor enthusiast, our work helps you:

Visualise catchments and landforms with clarity
Engage communities in environmental storytelling
Support planning and decision-making
Or simply celebrate the whenua in a new dimension

See the land. Feel the terrain. Tell the story.

title: Frequently asked questions
text:
What materials do you use for 3D printing?
We use plant-based PLA filament, made from renewable biomass sources like cornstarch or sugarcane. It‚Äôs durable, eco-friendly, and supports multi-colour printing‚Äîideal for highlighting specific landscape features such as rivers, land boundaries, or zones.

What is the typical size of a 3D model?
Every model is custom-sized to suit your requirements‚Äîfrom small desktop displays to large-format, multi-part models. We‚Äôll help you determine the best scale and dimensions during the consultation.

How long does it take to create a model?
Most models are completed within 2‚Äì4 weeks, depending on complexity, data availability, and print size. We‚Äôll confirm your timeline as part of the initial project scoping.

Can you customise the model features (e.g., points of interest, colours)?
Absolutely. We can highlight monitoring sites, catchments, land use zones, or infrastructure using custom colour palettes or added markers. Just let us know what matters to your audience.

How do you ensure sustainability?
Sustainability is at the core of both our materials and our ethos.

We print locally in Aotearoa using bio-based PLA
Packaging uses recycled and paper-based materials‚Äîno bubble wrap
Shipping is done in recyclable or compostable courier bags

Custom 3D Terrain Models ‚Äî Built Just for You
At KƒÅkƒÅp≈ç Industries, we create bespoke 3D printed topographic and bathymetric models tailored to your exact area of interest. Whether it‚Äôs a freshwater catchment, property parcel, management unit, or another defined boundary, we can bring it to life in three dimensions.

title: Custom 3D topographic models
text:
Who Uses Our Models?
Over 100 clients across Aotearoa have trusted us to produce models for:

Environmental planning and management
Public consultation and community engagement
Education, outreach, and scientific storytelling
Striking, land-inspired art displays

From regional councils and iwi authorities to researchers, teachers, and tramping clubs‚Äîour models are designed to inform, engage, and inspire.

title: Custom 3D topographic models
text:
How it works





Zealandia continent


1 - Consultation
Share your area of interest‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a GPS location, a named catchment, or a custom boundary. We can also work from your shapefiles.
2 - Data Sourcing
We gather the best available national datasets, or use your supplied data, including elevation, rivers, landcover, roads, and more.
3 - Model Design
A 3D rendering is prepared and shared for your approval before printing. You‚Äôll see exactly what your model will look like.
4 - Delivery
Your model is printed, packaged in plastic-free materials, and shipped anywhere in New Zealand.

title: About us
text:
KƒÅkƒÅp≈ç Industries (NZBN: 9429052266102) was founded by Isaac Bain out of a passion for turning New Zealand‚Äôs landscapes into tangible works of art. Based in ≈åtautahi / Christchurch, we specialise in crafting physical cartographic models, with a particular focus on 3D topographic elevation models that faithfully represent the contours of our whenua.
Our work blends scientific precision with creative design, making our models ideal for:

Environmental education
Community and stakeholder engagement
Public exhibitions and striking visual displays

By combining Isaac‚Äôs background in environmental science and data visualisation with advanced 3D printing technology, we produce models that are both accurate and visually compelling.
We‚Äôre inspired by the kƒÅkƒÅp≈ç‚Äîa rare, resilient, and uniquely Aotearoa species. Like our namesake, we believe in thoughtful innovation and strengthening the connection between people and the natural world.
Let us help you hold the land in your hands. üåè

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
3D-Printed Terrain Models for Regional Councils
At KƒÅkƒÅp≈ç Industries, we partner with regional councils across Aotearoa to create highly detailed 3D printed models that support community engagement, environmental planning, and long-term stewardship of natural resources.
These models offer an innovative, tactile way to communicate spatial data, helping your teams better connect with stakeholders, whƒÅnau, and the wider public.

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
Why Use 3D Models for Engagement?





Otago and Southland regions


Conventional GIS maps and technical reports can be difficult for non-specialists to interpret. Physical 3D models create a bridge‚Äîtransforming complex data into a format that is:

üß† Intuitive ‚Äì Easily understood by diverse audiences
üëÅÔ∏è Visual ‚Äì Eye-catching and memorable in public spaces
üìö Educational ‚Äì Ideal for workshops, hui, and exhibitions

They foster understanding of environmental challenges such as erosion, water quality, flood risks, and biodiversity loss‚Äîgrounded in the actual terrain people live in.

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
Applications for Regional Councils
Our models are being used by councils for:





Pokaiwhenua catchment



Catchment Management: Showcasing sedimentation patterns, riparian areas, and hydrological flow.

Land Use Planning: Illustrating proposed zoning, infrastructure, or conservation interventions.

Climate Change Adaptation: Communicating the impacts of sea-level rise or flooding on local landscapes.

Biodiversity Initiatives: Highlighting habitats, planting corridors, and ecological values.

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
What Sets Us Apart
We combine high-resolution GIS and LiDAR data with multi-colour 3D printing to create models tailored to your region and objectives. Every model is:
üó∫Ô∏è Customised to match your spatial units (e.g.¬†FMUs, catchments, zones)
üß© Printable in modular pieces for easy transport and targeted engagement
‚ôªÔ∏è Made with eco-friendly PLA from renewable plant-based sources
üè¢ Suitable for consultation events, classrooms, and permanent displays

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
Freshwater management units





Hawke‚Äôs Bay region separated into 11 FMUs


We specialise in producing multi-part terrain models, such as freshwater management units printed at the same scale. These can be pieced together like a jigsaw or taken individually to local workshops and community hui.

title: 3D-printed models for regional councils
text:
Let‚Äôs Work Together
Whether you‚Äôre preparing for a regional plan review, public consultation, or science communication initiative, our 3D models offer a powerful, people-friendly way to visualise place and process. Contact us to discuss your project. We‚Äôre happy to liaise directly with your GIS team, and can work with a wide range of formats and projections.
